lines.text:
[to Anna]
When a woman who has much to say says nothing, her silence can be deafening.
Until now, Madame Leonowens, I did not understand supposition,man can be satisfied with only one woman.

[to Anna]
If love was a choice, who would ever choose such exquisite pain?
I never danced with an Englishwoman before, mem.
Nor I with a king.
[last lines]

It is always surprising how small a part of life is taken up by meaningful moments. Most often they are over before they start although they cast a light on the future and make the person who originated them unforgettable. Anna had shined such a light on Siam.

[to King Mongkut]
Your Majesty, promise me... Promise me that I will see you again.

[to Princess Fa-ying]
I will be there in your dreams, as you will be in mine

[to King Mongkut]
Life is... precious, especially if you're a Christian and only allowed to have one.
I would like to know why... , if science can unravel something as beautiful as music... , why it cannot posit a solution for a schoolteacher and a king.
The manner in which people might understand such new possibilities is also process of evolution.
Everything in Siam has its own time.

[to King Mongkut]
You cannot shut the world out forever. Believe me, I've tried.
Why did you come back?
Because I could not imagine a Siam without you.

[to Anna]
Mother, what's a concubine?
Son of teacher is forgetting I am son of King.
Son of teacher couldn't care less.
You will sit somewhere else!
I will not!
Louis, remember what I told you.
I'm sorry Mother, but he started it.
In my country, man never tell a woman he is sorry about anything... ever! If you had father, you would know that.
You don't have a father! You have a map!
[Louis pushes the prince]
Louis!
It is forbidden to touch royalty!
I didn't touch you!- I shoved you! Why don't you get one of your servants to shove me back?
I remember my first rice festival. People come from everywhere to see king. He bless all crops, and it begin to rain. I think he was a God.
And now?
He is also a man.
[first lines]

She was the first English woman I had ever met. And it seemed to me she knew more about the world than anyone. But it was a world Siam was afraid would consume them. The monsoon winds had whispered her arrival like a coming storm. Some welcomed the rain, but others feared a raging flood. Still she came, unaware of the suspicion that preceded her. But it wasn't until years later, that I began to appreciate how brave she was, and how alone she must have felt. An English woman. The first I had ever met.
Sir is married?
A widow. Can you please explain to me why you call me "Sir"?
Women do not stand in the presence of His Excellency.
When presented to His Majesty, you and son will remember to touch forehead to floor.
Your Excellency, although we have become better acquainted with your customs, we have certainly not forgotten our own.
Then how will you greet him?
With the utmost respect.
You are teacher?
Yes, Your Majesty, I am.
You do not look sufficient of age for scientific teaching. How many years have you?
Enough to know that age and wisdom do not necessarily go hand in hand, Your Majesty.
Presenting original pupil and heir apparent. Prince Chulalongkorn.
[to the Prince]
This, my son, is your new teacher.
It is a great honor, Your Highness.
Your Majesty, I believe there has been enough insult caused by this woman who believes herself to be the equal of a man.
Not the equal of a man, Chao Phya. The equal of a King.
[from trailer]
[to King Mongkut]
These are dangerous times, Your Majesty. A foreigner's influence will be equally sore.
How did Mem survive?
The same way you will. One awful day at a time.
Most people do not see the world as it is. They see it as they are.
My mind has taken me down many roads of late. All of which lead absolutely nowhere. What would Buddha say of that?
That roads are for journeys, ma'am, not destinations.
Gazing at the moon.
Yes, it is beautiful.
As the sun rises, she will surrender the night, but she is always with him, even when he cannot see her.
It must be a great comfort to him.
Yes.
Moonshee, why does the king have so many wives?
That is an excellent question. For your mother
You have the power to lead your people...
Now is not the time to change the way that things are done!
Well, if not now, then when? How many more people must die so that you might save face?

Twenty three wives, forty two concubines, fifty eight offspring, and ten more on the way. Each one unique. Each one my hope for the future. I understand your surprise. Not as many as the Emperor of China, but he did not spend half of life in monastery. King making up for lost time.
Heir to throne must never be involved in issue of bond-servent. It will resolve itself in time.
Like my house?
You are learning.

In my letter confirming my employment, Your Majesty, you claimed you wanted Siam to take its place among the nations of the modern world. You spoke of building something greater than yourself. A country where no man is above the law. Which is why I chose to come here.

[to Lord Bradley]
You raised your glass to him. You commended him for his vision. All the while, you were waiting to take his country from him.

[to King Mongkut]
Why are you doing this?

[speaks in English]
He wrote to me, to bid me farewell. Believing that I was lost forever on the inside! To commit his life in monastery...

[interrupts her, in Thai]
You will speak in your native tongue!
Everyone should have legends, I think. They allow us to dream.

[to King Mongkut]
Perhaps you should simply say what it is you're trying so hard not to.
l have decided to give self anniversary dinner and invite important English nobles and diplomats.
l don't understand.
French lndochina grows stronger and more aggressive. But if l improve our foreign intercourse with your queen's special envoy, French will think three times before trying to undermine Siam.
That's very clever, Your Majesty.
As if to sound English bugles in own defense. You shall take charge of all formalities as Mem is obvious choice to make certain guests feel at home.
But... the anniversary is when?
Three weeks from yesterday.
Three weeks? That's impossible!
Mem... The egg is in the bottle.
I admire vision, Lady Bradley, in all its forms.

[ascending a staircase, arriving late for dinner, a little out of breath]
Forgive me, Your Majesty. l believe the sun set a little earlier today.

[amused]
Mem. You arrange all this to influence positive future of Siam. And now you steal attention away from it.

[shyly]
Well, that was not my intention, Your Majesty.
You! Why did you not go to monastery like king order?
Because l lost one man to the jungle, Your Majesty. l was not about to let that happen again.
